Greetings!
Are you looking for the best quality natural plant extract products at great prices \ and with speedy and reliable delivery? If so, you are having a good day because \ ShanShan Biotechnology is ready to serve you.
We own advanced equipment and technology, utilize high-quality materials and solvent, \ and employ a highly-skilled staff operating under strict management. After capital \ investments amounting to nearly US$80 million, our company has the largest extraction \ base in Asia. We introduced two sets of automatic supercritical carbon dioxide \ extract equipment (1500L¡Á3 and 3500L¡Á3 ) from UHDE company, Krupp Group (Germany). \ We have one set of refining equipment from Messo Company (also Germany). And three \ sets of advanced dynamic countercurrent extraction equipment using membrane \ filtration and concentration. Our factory covers an area of 1,520,000 square meters. \ Our factory got the certificate of ISO9001, ISO14001, HACCP and Kosher, Meanwhile we \ have advanced analytical apparatus such as HPLC, GC and UV etc.
We are already producing the high-ratio water-soluble Cinnamon Bark Extract with \ de-cinnamic aldehyde and de-coumarin. We also produce the other plant extracts, \ ingredients and plants oils by Supercritical Fluid extraction with natural carbon \ dioxide. HPLC, TLC, GC chromatograms and factory image are available on request.
Write to us for more info.
Best wishes,
Mr. Dong ShanShan Biotechnology co., ltd. Wuhu. China ShanShan Group. T:+86 553 5719388 F:+86 553 5719963 E-mail: dong6699@gmail.com shanshanbio@gmail.com Web: www.naturalcn.com Add: Gangwan Road, Economic & Tech zone, Wuhu,China, 241007

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: [Fwd: PHP Fatal error: php-gtk: Could not open display in Unknownon
email.body:
Andrei Zmievski wrote: > > > ------------------------------------------------------------------------ > > Subject: > PHP Fatal error: php-gtk: Could not open display in Unknown on line 0 > From: > Reindl Harald <h.reindl@thelounge.net> > Date: > Mon, 03 Mar 2008 10:37:42 +0100 > To: > andrei@php.net > > To: > andrei@php.net > > > > Hi > > If you activate php_gtk in "/etc/php.ini" you will be unable to use > php for cron-jobs and shellscripts over ssh even until you diable it! > > I can not believe taht im the only person who uses php for > shellscripting :-) >
... for windows we just dump a php-cli.ini in the same directory - search path stuff makes this work since you'll probably use a separate binary for cron-jobs and shell scripts on win - on nix it's a bit more complicated
Any chance we can hack in a php-gtk.ini so we can totally avoid any issues?
Elizabeth
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

Andrei Zmievski wrote: > Can someone give this a quick test (configure, build)? > > http://www.php.net/~andrei/php-gtk-2.0.0.tar.gz > > -Andrei Give me a minute to make sure I have the latest gtk libs and I'll give it a roll-up - where shall I shove the finished win32 builds?
elizabeth

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Quick test of packaging?
email.body:
>> Builds and appears to run fine with windows (but the win build system >> always regenerates source ;). I have a build ready to go, with >> gtksourceview and libglade extensions. I also have gtkhtml building but >> it needs so many dependencies I have that in a different package. I >> couldn't find prebuilt libs for the others and don't have time to build >> them right now, so things like the svg pixbuf loader, libsexy, gtkextra, >> scintilla, and gtkspell will have to wait until I get some libraries. >> Core and the extensions that build appear to work (I don't have a good >> gtkhtml test, anyone care to write one?) > > Ok. Can you check the Windows builds into php-gtk-web/distributions? > > -Andrei
Up it went - I included libglade and gtksourceview because their requirements are light and they work well, gtk_html isn't up yet because I can't get it to cooperate on windows - it'll just have to wait for when I tackle building gtk again.
Should be unzip and run on windows - the php included is a stock build.
Elizabeth
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

Hi, look at http://pb.impressivegames.com/ http://pb.impressivegames.com/ The PriadoBlender has a v2 beta that compile Gtk or Gtk2 However I compiled some Gtk2 apps, it does'nt run for all my sources without knowing really why...

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] problems with php-gtk2 on ubuntu-gutsy
email.body:
hello,
I'm trying to build php-gtk2 on ubuntu/gutsy (latest stable release). It works, the build process is OK. It's based on my wiki guide :
http://php.classes.free.fr/wiki/index.php?title=Gtk2/InstallUnix#ubuntu_Feisty__.2B_php-gtk2_beta
The problem is about Gtk support. Ubuntu Gusty is bundled with libgtk 2.12. I suppose that's why I have a problem at script shutdown.
With "php -i" and any script trying to exit(), process never close.
You can find my build process log at this address :
- http://php-gtk.pastebin.ca/859588 (configure) - http://php-gtk.pastebin.ca/859590 (make)
I have tried to not bundle extra libraries (except libglade).
Is there a way to correct this problem ?
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] fixing the versioning
email.body:
Hi all,
I _think_ I'm there - as in, everything appears to build as expected whether from cache or from scratch - but I'd like some confirmation of these figures.
Elizabeth, do you have the coverage output from the build logs handy for 2.10?
e.g. on my system, 2.6 build:
======================================================================== Gtk Coverage ======================================================================== Functions : 91.7% written (66/72) Methods : 96.3% written (1851/1922) Constructors : 99.3% written (150/151) Property accessors : 97.1% written (169/174)
======================================================================== Gdk Coverage ======================================================================== Functions : 87.3% written (62/71) Methods : 86.5% written (315/364) Constructors : 90.9% written (20/22) Property accessors : 97.5% written (79/81)
same system, 2.10 build:
======================================================================== Gtk Coverage ======================================================================== Functions : 80.4% written (74/92) Methods : 95.9% written (2194/2288) Constructors : 99.4% written (170/171) Property accessors : 97.1% written (169/174)
======================================================================== Gdk Coverage ======================================================================== Functions : 86.5% written (64/74) Methods : 86.0% written (325/378) Constructors : 90.9% written (20/22) Property accessors : 97.5% written (79/81)
It seems about right to me, but you threw me with that line about 'ONLY include those overrides/defs'.
- Steph
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: fixing the versioning
email.body:
> Windows defines it as (for example) COMPILE_DL_HTML2 and nix defines it > as PHP_GTK_DL_HTML2 or something like that - I don't have time to look > it up at the moment but there was a thread on the mailing list about it. > So right now you can't compile php-gtk extensions shared on nix.

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] [patch] GtkSourceView Searching
email.body:
Probably isn't too late to sneak it in either ;)
----- Original Message ----- From: "Andrei Zmievski" <andrei@gravitonic.com> To: "Bob Majdak Jr" <bob@kateos.org> Cc: "PHP-GTK Developers" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> Sent: Monday, January 21, 2008 6:59 PM Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] [patch] GtkSourceView Searching
> Looks good. > > Bob Majdak Jr wrote: >> Probably too late to sneak this in to 2.0.0. >> >> This patch fixes/adds to the GtkSourceView currently non-generated >> functions. It >> allows for the use of the special search feature allowing case >> insensitive >> searching (a built in part of GtkSourceView) >> >> I spent a lot of time on this, ended up rewriting some of the defintions. >> GtkSourceView has a fake type GtkSourceIter, which is /just/ a >> GtkTextIter, and in fact GtkSourceIter is not even in the GtkSourceView >> code as a type, just the documentation. However, it does have >> gtk_source_iter_forward_search() which when bound to a GBoxed of >> GtkSourceIter breaks *all* GtkTextIter methods. My solution to this was >> to drop _forward_search() and _backward_search() on the main >> GtkSourceView class, in addition to some new flags. >> >> Screenshot: >> http://www.opsat.net/temp/sourceview-search.jpg >> >> Example Code: >> http://p.opsat.net/v/172/54 >> (not the best for example) >> (it is a copy paste from the project I am working on but eh) >> >> Added Methods: >> array/bool GtkSourceView::forward_search( >> GtkTreeIter start, string text, >> int flags[, GtkTreeIter stop] >> ); >> array/bool GtkSourceView::backward_search( >> GtkTreeIter start, string text, >> int flags[, GtkTreeIter stop] >> ); >> >> Both return array(GtkTreeIter, GtkTreeIter), the start/stop of the >> match when a match is found, and Boolean false when no match was found. >> >> Added Flags: >> GtkSourceView::SEARCH_VISIBLE_ONLY >> GtkSourceView::SEARCH_TEXT_ONLY >> GtkSourceView::SEARCH_CASE_INSENSITIVE >> >> >> > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release?
email.body:
Good grief - I'm away for a few days and everything blows up.
First of all, the generator should be automatically detecting the gtk library version you're building against and ONLY include those overrides/defs. That's what the numbers after the include statements are for (include "blah.def" "2.10") If you're building against 2.6 and getting the 2.10 overrides included in your generated files (after deleting the def caches) then there is an issue with the generator system. I know at one point someone had taken out the strings around the "2.10" in the override file which borked things (php will juggle that to 2.1 instead of 2.10 which makes version_compare not work as expected)
I thought I put BACK all those quotes but I might have missed some.
Now, if you're building against the 2.6 gtk libs and the 2.10 defs and libs ARE being included - we have an issue. Look at the configure and make sure your library version is being detected correctly and make sure you're using at least 5.2.x as the php binary to do the generation (I know earlier version of php had issues) I've managed to build cvs against 2.6, 2.8, 2.10 and 2.12 libs successfully on Windows Steph, so I'd venture to say that something is rotten in the state of Denmark if you're getting the wrong defs included. Maybe the detection in the windows build system is borked.
Thanks, Elizabeth
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] [patch] GtkSourceView Searching
[PHP-GTK-DEV] INI problem
email.body:
Hi all,
I went to fix the shared build issue on *nix and discovered we can't load PHP-GTK extensions in 5.3.0 even under Windows. Hyphens are illegal syntax in INI directives now. (I know this because an old 5.3-dev told me so - the current message is rather less helpful, it just says 'parse error'.)
Renaming our INI directives to use underscores doesn't work because the prefix needs to match the extension name...
Jani, can you assist?
Thanks,
- Steph
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Compiler warnings and etc
email.body:
Andrei, Elizabeth, all -
In the gtk_curve_set_vector() override, the line:
vectors[i] = Z_LVAL_PP(data);
throws a compiler warning under MSVC 6. I changed it to:
vectors[i] = Z_DVAL_PP(data);
since the data points to a double, not a long. Fixing this doesn't actually clear the warning, thanks to a bug in the VC6 compiler, so I just wanted to highlight that change in case it causes any trouble.
The other thing relates to the 'hack' to load GD under Windows. There were a couple of compiler warnings I killed in there, but I've no idea how to test the functionality. Can you please either mail me a test script or test it for yourself fresh out of CVS? Note: I moved DL_FETCH_SYMBOL to GetProcAddress for clarity in the win32-only section, they're one and the same thing to Zend except that GetProcAddress is rather better documented ;)
Just two compiler warnings left - one (GtkEntry::get_inner_border() in GTK 2.10 and up) will probably need an override if we really want to return a GtkBorder struct as a constant (??? defs-munging might be nicer), the other is the DVAL one mentioned earlier.
Assuming I didn't actually break anything, that's me done for pre-release stuff. I'd still like to do things with the Windows build system, but that won't affect anything else.
Some testing would be good at this stage...
- Steph
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

Steph Fox Wrote: > Theoretically, *nix shared extension builds should work now. > Please let me know if they needed a '2' on the end...
I tested it with GtkSourceView only and it worked. Built, installed, and ran it fine. However it still has the "wrong" filename, it ends up as sourceview.so instead of php_gtk2_sourceview.so.

Please let me > + know if they needed a '2' on the end... > + > + * ext/gtk+/gdk-2.10.defs > + ext/gtk+/gdk-2.12.defs > + ext/gtk+/gdk.defs > + ext/gtk+/gtk-2.10.defs > + ext/gtk+/gtk-2.12.defs > + ext/gtk+/gtk-2.8.defs > + ext/gtk+/gtk.defs > + generator/override.php > + generator/scheme.php: > + Defs should only include the previous version .defs file and the current > + types.defs file, if one exists. Note that def caches are now versioned. > + > + * ext/gtk+/gdk-2.12.overrides > + ext/gtk+/gdk.overrides > + ext/gtk+/gtk-2.10.overrides > + ext/gtk+/gtk-2.12.overrides > + ext/gtk+/gtk-2.8.overrides > + ext/gtk+/gtk.overrides > + generator/override.php > + generator/scheme.php: > + This works fine, but I forgot to move the defs to the new scheme. > Steph Fox Wrote: > > Theoretically, *nix shared extension builds should work now. > > Please let me know if they needed a '2' on the end... > > I tested it with GtkSourceView only and it worked. Built, installed, and > ran it fine. However it still has the "wrong" filename, it ends up as > sourceview.so instead of php_gtk2_sourceview.so. > > changelog wrote: >> changelog Wed Jan 23 01:31:44 2008 UTC >> >> Modified files: /php-gtk ChangeLog Log: >> ChangeLog update >> >> http://cvs.php.net/viewvc.cgi/php-gtk/ChangeLog?r1=1.568&r2=1.569&diff_format=u >> Index: php-gtk/ChangeLog >> diff -u php-gtk/ChangeLog:1.568 php-gtk/ChangeLog:1.569 >> --- php-gtk/ChangeLog:1.568 Tue Jan 22 01:31:40 2008 >> +++ php-gtk/ChangeLog Wed Jan 23 01:31:44 2008 >> @@ -1,3 +1,40 @@ >> +2008-01-22 Steph Fox <steph.fox@virgin.net> >> + >> + * ext/extra/php_gtkextra.c >> + ext/html/php_html.c >> + ext/libglade/php_libglade.c >> + ext/libsexy/php_libsexy.c >> + ext/mozembed/php_mozembed.c >> + ext/scintilla/php_scintilla.c >> + ext/sourceview/php_sourceview.c >> + ext/spell/php_spell.c >> + win32/confutils.js: >> + Theoretically, *nix shared extension builds should work now. >> Please let me >> + know if they needed a '2' on the end... >> + >> + * ext/gtk+/gdk-2.10.defs >> + ext/gtk+/gdk-2.12.defs >> + ext/gtk+/gdk.defs >> + ext/gtk+/gtk-2.10.defs >> + ext/gtk+/gtk-2.12.defs >> + ext/gtk+/gtk-2.8.defs >> + ext/gtk+/gtk.defs >> + generator/override.php >> + generator/scheme.php: >> + Defs should only include the previous version .defs file and the >> current >> + types.defs file, if one exists. Note that def caches are now >> versioned. >> + >> + * ext/gtk+/gdk-2.12.overrides >> + ext/gtk+/gdk.overrides >> + ext/gtk+/gtk-2.10.overrides >> + ext/gtk+/gtk-2.12.overrides >> + ext/gtk+/gtk-2.8.overrides >> + ext/gtk+/gtk.overrides >> + generator/override.php >> + generator/scheme.php: >> + This works fine, but I forgot to move the defs to the new scheme. >> (Cue >> + much confusion here - until now.) >> + >> 2008-01-21 Bob Majdak Jr <bob@kateos.org> >> * ext/sourceview/sourceview.defs >> > > -- > Bob Majdak Jr > KateOS Rofflecopter Pilot > http://www.kateos.org > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: nix shared ext
email.body:
I consider it a bug in that, what if for example there was a /real/ PHP extension called Sexy? PHP-GTK would overwrite it with it's own libsexy extension. I've talked about this before with Elizabeth and Anant and I think we were in agreement that that should be fixed. I think at the time though none of us really had a clue about what exactly needs the tweak, nor time to investigate it. Really it should be the same as the Windows DLL's with the prefix, IMHO.
-- Bob Majdak Jr KateOS Rofflecopter Pilot http://www.kateos.org
Steph Fox wrote: > OK, that needs a *nix build merchant - if you agree that it's a bug. > > I would've expected it to be sourceview.so from the code, but I don't > know if that's wrong or not. email.body:
All I had done was:
./buildconf ./configure --with-sourceview=shared make && make install
And it was magically there.

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: nix shared ext
email.body:
The Windows ones are php_gtk_sexy2.dll.
If you want to change the naming of the .so ones to match that you'll probably need to fiddle with a single line in php_gtk.m4 - with Andrei's agreement of course.
Let me know if it turns out to affect all (e.g. if there needs to be a 2 at the end of the constant in the sources) because that will require a minor change at the doze end too.
Thanks,
- Steph

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] [patch] GtkScaleButton Methods
Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] [patch] GtkScaleButton Methods
Fw: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Compiler warnings and etc
email.body:
... and moving to 5_3 to fill in Jani's bug report, I'm now seeing warnings that aren't there with 5_2 <sigh />
I'll go through them tomorrow.
- Steph
----- Original Message ----- From: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> To: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> Cc: "Andrei" <andrei@gravitonic.com>; "Elizabeth Smith" <auroraeosrose@gmail.com> Sent: Wednesday, January 23, 2008 2:33 AM Subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Compiler warnings and etc
> Andrei, Elizabeth, all - > > In the gtk_curve_set_vector() override, the line: > > vectors[i] = Z_LVAL_PP(data); > > throws a compiler warning under MSVC 6. I changed it to: > > vectors[i] = Z_DVAL_PP(data); > > since the data points to a double, not a long. Fixing this doesn't > actually clear the warning, thanks to a bug in the VC6 compiler, so I just > wanted to highlight that change in case it causes any trouble. > > The other thing relates to the 'hack' to load GD under Windows. There were > a couple of compiler warnings I killed in there, but I've no idea how to > test the functionality. Can you please either mail me a test script or > test it for yourself fresh out of CVS? Note: I moved DL_FETCH_SYMBOL to > GetProcAddress for clarity in the win32-only section, they're one and the > same thing to Zend except that GetProcAddress is rather better documented > ;) > > Just two compiler warnings left - one (GtkEntry::get_inner_border() in GTK > 2.10 and up) will probably need an override if we really want to return a > GtkBorder struct as a constant (??? defs-munging might be nicer), the > other is the DVAL one mentioned earlier. > > Assuming I didn't actually break anything, that's me done for pre-release > stuff. I'd still like to do things with the Windows build system, but that > won't affect anything else. > > Some testing would be good at this stage... > > - Steph > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] [patch] GtkSourceView Searching
email.body:
Looks good.
Bob Majdak Jr wrote: > Probably too late to sneak this in to 2.0.0. > > This patch fixes/adds to the GtkSourceView currently non-generated > functions. It > allows for the use of the special search feature allowing case insensitive > searching (a built in part of GtkSourceView) > > I spent a lot of time on this, ended up rewriting some of the > defintions. GtkSourceView has a fake type GtkSourceIter, which is /just/ > a GtkTextIter, and in fact GtkSourceIter is not even in the > GtkSourceView code as a type, just the documentation. However, it does > have gtk_source_iter_forward_search() which when bound to a GBoxed of > GtkSourceIter breaks *all* GtkTextIter methods. My solution to this was > to drop _forward_search() and _backward_search() on the main > GtkSourceView class, in addition to some new flags. > > Screenshot: > http://www.opsat.net/temp/sourceview-search.jpg > > Example Code: > http://p.opsat.net/v/172/54 > (not the best for example) > (it is a copy paste from the project I am working on but eh) > > Added Methods: > array/bool GtkSourceView::forward_search( > GtkTreeIter start, string text, > int flags[, GtkTreeIter stop] > ); > array/bool GtkSourceView::backward_search( > GtkTreeIter start, string text, > int flags[, GtkTreeIter stop] > ); > > Both return array(GtkTreeIter, GtkTreeIter), the start/stop of the > match when a match is found, and Boolean false when no match was found. > > Added Flags: > GtkSourceView::SEARCH_VISIBLE_ONLY > GtkSourceView::SEARCH_TEXT_ONLY > GtkSourceView::SEARCH_CASE_INSENSITIVE > > >
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release?
email.body:
Morning Elizabeth!
> Good grief - I'm away for a few days and everything blows up. > > First of all, the generator should be automatically detecting the gtk > library version you're building against and ONLY include those > overrides/defs. That's what the numbers after the include statements are > for (include "blah.def" "2.10") If you're building against 2.6 and > getting the 2.10 overrides included in your generated files (after > deleting the def caches) then there is an issue with the generator > system. I know at one point someone had taken out the strings around > the "2.10" in the override file which borked things (php will juggle > that to 2.1 instead of 2.10 which makes version_compare not work as > expected)
Yes, so I found.
> I thought I put BACK all those quotes but I might have missed some.
I'm just making it so it doesn't need to rely on quotes. It works with the filenames instead, which is a tad sturdier. Overrides are working nicely here, I'm just sorting out defs then will throw it into cvs for other people/systems to test.
> Now, if you're building against the 2.6 gtk libs and the 2.10 defs and > libs ARE being included - we have an issue. Look at the configure and > make sure your library version is being detected correctly and make sure > you're using at least 5.2.x as the php binary to do the generation (I > know earlier version of php had issues) I've managed to build cvs > against 2.6, 2.8, 2.10 and 2.12 libs successfully on Windows Steph, so > I'd venture to say that something is rotten in the state of Denmark if > you're getting the wrong defs included. Maybe the detection in the > windows build system is borked.
Nope, the detection's working just fine.
- Steph
> > Thanks, > Elizabeth > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release?
email.body:
I would have /liked/ to have had GtkScaleButton done - however I also am suffering the new-job-workload-hey-bob-do-this drama. The current patch for it worked - but as andrei pointed out /maybe not/ the best way (though last i tried the only way that actually worked right).
There was also a patch that fixed some TRMLSness compiling on Linux, but as Elizabeth knows that stuff makes me swear outloud so I didn't commit it as *nobody* commented on it.
-- Bob Majdak Jr KateOS Rofflecopter Pilot http://www.kateos.org
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release?
email.body:
Can you point me to that TSRM patch again?
I think we can omit GtkScaleButton until 2.0.1 or something. We can't expect to have complete coverage for the release and actually having a release will be a big boon for our users.
-Andrei
Bob Majdak Jr wrote: > I would have /liked/ to have had GtkScaleButton done - however I also am > suffering the new-job-workload-hey-bob-do-this drama. The current patch > for it > worked - but as andrei pointed out /maybe not/ the best way (though last > i tried > the only way that actually worked right). > > There was also a patch that fixed some TRMLSness compiling on Linux, but as > Elizabeth knows that stuff makes me swear outloud so I didn't commit it as > *nobody* commented on it. >
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release?
email.body:
On Jan 9, 2008 2:02 PM, Andrei Zmievski <andrei@gravitonic.com> wrote:
> Can you point me to that TSRM patch again? > > I think we can omit GtkScaleButton until 2.0.1 or something. We can't > expect to have complete coverage for the release and actually having a > release will be a big boon for our users.
Yes, please! I've been following the list for quite some time (since months before the first Zeta Release). I check out from SVN and compile every so often and so far have no huge issues. I'd like to see a bit more documentation for GtkMozEmbed... I've considered signing up to help with documentation, but I work full time, do web development as an aside and I code for fun... I managed to get a few of the things for GtkMozEmbed that I needed to work via PyGtk Docs, the rest I have left on my todo list (that consists of sticky notes on the edges of my monitor.)
On behalf (I know I don't have any real right to say this) of all of the PHP-GTK2 users: Please make a release!
> > > -Andrei > > Bob Majdak Jr wrote: > > I would have /liked/ to have had GtkScaleButton done - however I also am > > suffering the new-job-workload-hey-bob-do-this drama. The current patch > > for it > > worked - but as andrei pointed out /maybe not/ the best way (though last > > i tried > > the only way that actually worked right). > > > > There was also a patch that fixed some TRMLSness compiling on Linux, but > as > > Elizabeth knows that stuff makes me swear outloud so I didn't commit it > as > > *nobody* commented on it. > > > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php > >
-- - Cory Christison

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release?
email.body:
Hi,
> Just checking in..
Here's a draft release announcement. There's not much content (frankly, there's nothing much to say ;)) - but I think it gets the message across. Feel free to suggest additions or changes. If everyone's ready, we could tag and release on sunday.
-- After almost two and a half years of development, we are proud to release version 2.0 of PHP-GTK! This release marks PHP-GTK 2 as stable and comes with support for Gtk+ versions 2.6 through 2.12. Although support for versions 2.8 upwards is not 100% complete, we hope to cover as much of the API as possible in upcoming releases.
This release comes with support for custom GTypes and Signals, more API coverage, and the usual slew of bug fixes. Take a look at the Changelog for detailed information on changes since the beta.
We hope you will enjoy developing applications with PHP-GTK 2. Please don't hesitate to file bug reports at the bug tracker, or discuss issues related to the release at the development mailing list. Have fun! --
Cheers, Anant
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release?
email.body:
Hi,
> I wouldn't be too specific about how long it was in development.. > makes us look slow. :) Could just say "after a long development and > QA cycle".
Revised announcement:
-- After a long development and QA cycle, we are proud to release version 2.0 of PHP-GTK. This release marks PHP-GTK 2 as stable and comes with support for GTK+ versions 2.6 through 2.12. Although support for more recent versions than 2.8 is not 100% complete, we hope to cover as much of the API as possible in upcoming releases.
This release comes with support for custom GTypes and Signals, more API coverage, and the usual slew of bug fixes. Take a look at the Changelog for detailed information on changes since the beta.
If you're looking to learn PHP-GTK, the documentation is a great place to start. There's also an excellent book from Apress by Scott Mattocks on the topic. We hope you will enjoy developing applications with PHP- GTK 2. Please don't hesitate to file bug reports at the bug tracker, or give us feedback on the php-gtk-general mailing list. Have fun! --
I'll be linking to GTK+, the documentation, Scott's book, the bug tracker and mailing list.
Are we ready to tag and release yet? I know we're all set on the *nix end...
Cheers, Anant
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release?
email.body:
Let's try this again. What's stopping us from making the release? The beta has been out for a while and I don't think it makes sense to delay everything until we have some cool features like custom cell renderers ready.
-Andrei
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release?
email.body:
Findings:
1. Versioning's 99% of the way there but doesn't work with older versions. I.e. my 2.6 build, although correctly identified as such, tries to include 2.10 features for some still-unknown reason and so fails. We should probably simply have later versions include older overrides from the start, rather than do fancy footwork to make the older version skip over them, no? Does anyone know a good reason not to do it that way? 2. We need to get Edin to kill the GTK+ 1.3 headers in his zip.zip (win32 build environment). That had me going for a bit :\ 3. Little bits and pieces need tidying up, e.g. if I configure --all and a header for a lowly extension happens to be missing the entire build aborts. This was less of a problem when we only had one extension than it is now. --all should probably force the build and give just a warning at that point, so long as php-gtk itself is built. There are also a lot of compiler warnings here... I know the ZVAL_ZVAL definition in the Zend Engine throws some we can't get around, but it'd be nice to get this a bit cleaner. That's, erm, when it will build here :)
Will spend some time on it tomorrow.
- Steph
----- Original Message ----- From: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> To: "Andrei Zmievski" <andrei@gravitonic.com>; "Anant Narayanan" <anant@kix.in> Cc: "Elizabeth M Smith" <auroraeosrose@gmail.com>; "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> Sent: Sunday, January 20, 2008 6:59 PM Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release?
> Sorry, I'll be with you in a couple of hours. > > ----- Original Message ----- > From: "Andrei Zmievski" <andrei@gravitonic.com> > To: "Anant Narayanan" <anant@kix.in> > Cc: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com>; "Elizabeth M Smith" > <auroraeosrose@gmail.com>; "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> > Sent: Sunday, January 20, 2008 6:50 PM > Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release? > > >> I'm just waiting on the 'dows folks. As soon as they confirm all is >> well, I'll tag and release. >> >> -Andrei >> >> On Jan 20, 2008, at 6:42 AM, Anant Narayanan wrote: >> >>> Hi, >>> >>>> I wouldn't be too specific about how long it was in development.. >>>> makes us look slow. :) Could just say "after a long development and QA >>>> cycle". >>> >>> Revised announcement: >>> >>> -- >>> After a long development and QA cycle, we are proud to release version >>> 2.0 of PHP-GTK. This release marks PHP-GTK 2 as stable and comes with >>> support for GTK+ versions 2.6 through 2.12. Although support for more >>> recent versions than 2.8 is not 100% complete, we hope to cover as much >>> of the API as possible in upcoming releases. >>> >>> This release comes with support for custom GTypes and Signals, more API >>> coverage, and the usual slew of bug fixes. Take a look at the Changelog >>> for detailed information on changes since the beta. >>> >>> If you're looking to learn PHP-GTK, the documentation is a great place >>> to start. There's also an excellent book from Apress by Scott Mattocks >>> on the topic. We hope you will enjoy developing applications with >>> PHP-GTK 2. Please don't hesitate to file bug reports at the bug >>> tracker, or give us feedback on the php-gtk- general mailing list. Have >>> fun! >>> -- >>> >>> I'll be linking to GTK+, the documentation, Scott's book, the bug >>> tracker and mailing list. >>> >>> Are we ready to tag and release yet? I know we're all set on the *nix >>> end... >>> >>> Cheers, >>> Anant >> >> -- >> PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) >> To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >> > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >

> This shouldn't be going just to me.. we have a mailing list for a > purpose. > > -Andrei > > On Jan 20, 2008, at 6:46 PM, Steph Fox wrote: > >> Got it. The includes are the wrong way around (sorry, I didn't know >> how the versioning system worked at all so had to go from scratch). >> >> Basically gtk.overrides is including gtk-2.8.overrides, >> gtk-2.10.overrides and gtk-2.12.overrides, rather than the later >> ones including their predecessors. I think it's _supposed_ to skip >> earlier versions via the generator, but it isn't working. It'd be >> more robust to have say gtk-2.12.overrides include gtk.overrides et >> al at the top. I have 2.6, 2.8 and 2.10 on board so can test, but >> it's nearly 3am @ present... >> >> ----- Original Message ----- From: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> >> To: "Andrei" <andrei@gravitonic.com> >> Sent: Monday, January 21, 2008 2:10 AM >> Subject: Fw: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release? >> >> >>> Now I'm seeing versioning troubles: >>> >>> C:\sandbox\php-gtk>nmake >>> >>> Microsoft (R) Program Maintenance Utility Version 6.00.8168.0 >>> Copyright (C) Microsoft Corp 1988-1998. This release marks PHP-GTK 2 >>>>>>>>> as stable and comes with support for GTK+ versions 2.6 >>>>>>>>> through 2.12. Although support for more recent versions >>>>>>>>> than 2.8 is not 100% complete, we hope to cover as much of >>>>>>>>> the API as possible in upcoming releases. >>>>>>>>> >>>>>>>>> This release comes with support for custom GTypes and >>>>>>>>> Signals, more API coverage, and the usual slew of bug >>>>>>>>> fixes. Take a look at the Changelog for detailed >>>>>>>>> information on changes since the beta. >>>>>>>>> >>>>>>>>> If you're looking to learn PHP-GTK, the documentation is a >>>>>>>>> great place to start. There's also an excellent book from >>>>>>>>> Apress by Scott Mattocks on the topic. We hope you will >>>>>>>>> enjoy developing applications with PHP-GTK 2. Please don't >>>>>>>>> hesitate to file bug reports at the bug tracker, or give us >>>>>>>>> feedback on the php-gtk- general mailing list. Have fun! >>>>>>>>> -- >>>>>>>>> >>>>>>>>> I'll be linking to GTK+, the documentation, Scott's book, >>>>>>>>> the bug tracker and mailing list. >>>>>>>>> >>>>>>>>> Are we ready to tag and release yet? I know we're all set >>>>>>>>> on the *nix end... >>>>>>>>> >>>>>>>>> Cheers, >>>>>>>>> Anant >>>>>>>> >>>>> >>>> > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release?
email.body:
Oh, I forgot 4. - the generator won't work if E_STRICT is enabled. That was another interesting one, right up until I opened gen_atk.c to take a look.
And ps obviously the 2.6 build works fine if all those includes for later versions are removed from the base .defs and .overrides files.
----- Original Message ----- From: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> To: "Andrei Zmievski" <andrei@gravitonic.com>; "Anant Narayanan" <anant@kix.in> Cc: "Elizabeth M Smith" <auroraeosrose@gmail.com>; "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> Sent: Monday, January 21, 2008 2:58 AM Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release?
> Findings: > > 1. Versioning's 99% of the way there but doesn't work with older versions. > I.e. my 2.6 build, although correctly identified as such, tries to include > 2.10 features for some still-unknown reason and so fails. We should > probably simply have later versions include older overrides from the > start, rather than do fancy footwork to make the older version skip over > them, no? Does anyone know a good reason not to do it that way? > 2. We need to get Edin to kill the GTK+ 1.3 headers in his zip.zip (win32 > build environment). That had me going for a bit :\ > 3. Little bits and pieces need tidying up, e.g. if I configure --all and a > header for a lowly extension happens to be missing the entire build > aborts. This was less of a problem when we only had one extension than it > is now. --all should probably force the build and give just a warning at > that point, so long as php-gtk itself is built. There are also a lot of > compiler warnings here... I know the ZVAL_ZVAL definition in the Zend > Engine throws some we can't get around, but it'd be nice to get this a bit > cleaner. That's, erm, when it will build here :) > > Will spend some time on it tomorrow. > > - Steph > > ----- Original Message ----- > From: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> > To: "Andrei Zmievski" <andrei@gravitonic.com>; "Anant Narayanan" > <anant@kix.in> > Cc: "Elizabeth M Smith" <auroraeosrose@gmail.com>; "PHP-GTK dev" > <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> > Sent: Sunday, January 20, 2008 6:59 PM > Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release? > > >> Sorry, I'll be with you in a couple of hours. >> >> ----- Original Message ----- >> From: "Andrei Zmievski" <andrei@gravitonic.com> >> To: "Anant Narayanan" <anant@kix.in> >> Cc: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com>; "Elizabeth M Smith" >> <auroraeosrose@gmail.com>; "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> >> Sent: Sunday, January 20, 2008 6:50 PM >> Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release? >> >> >>> I'm just waiting on the 'dows folks. As soon as they confirm all is >>> well, I'll tag and release. >>> >>> -Andrei >>> >>> On Jan 20, 2008, at 6:42 AM, Anant Narayanan wrote: >>> >>>> Hi, >>>> >>>>> I wouldn't be too specific about how long it was in development.. >>>>> makes us look slow. :) Could just say "after a long development and >>>>> QA cycle". >>>> >>>> Revised announcement: >>>> >>>> -- >>>> After a long development and QA cycle, we are proud to release version >>>> 2.0 of PHP-GTK. This release marks PHP-GTK 2 as stable and comes with >>>> support for GTK+ versions 2.6 through 2.12. Although support for more >>>> recent versions than 2.8 is not 100% complete, we hope to cover as >>>> much of the API as possible in upcoming releases. >>>> >>>> This release comes with support for custom GTypes and Signals, more >>>> API coverage, and the usual slew of bug fixes. Take a look at the >>>> Changelog for detailed information on changes since the beta. >>>> >>>> If you're looking to learn PHP-GTK, the documentation is a great place >>>> to start. There's also an excellent book from Apress by Scott Mattocks >>>> on the topic. We hope you will enjoy developing applications with >>>> PHP-GTK 2. Please don't hesitate to file bug reports at the bug >>>> tracker, or give us feedback on the php-gtk- general mailing list. Have >>>> fun! >>>> -- >>>> >>>> I'll be linking to GTK+, the documentation, Scott's book, the bug >>>> tracker and mailing list. >>>> >>>> Are we ready to tag and release yet? I know we're all set on the *nix >>>> end... >>>> >>>> Cheers, >>>> Anant >>> >>> -- >>> PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) >>> To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >>> >> >> -- >> PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) >> To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >> >

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release?
email.body:
This might be a silly question... but if I recall right the last build Elizabeth did was Unzip and go all self contained on Windows, did not interact with the system GTK... so... why not just /give/ them Gtk 2.12. Then everyone will be using a PHP-GTK2 with max features for max lawlz without borking the system.
Or does this go back to the whole "but it won't work on windows 95!" thing? If that is the case there is probably a good reason for that.
-- Bob Majdak Jr KateOS Rofflecopter Pilot http://www.kateos.org
Steph Fox wrote: > Oh, I forgot 4. - the generator won't work if E_STRICT is enabled. That > was another interesting one, right up until I opened gen_atk.c to take a > look. > > And ps obviously the 2.6 build works fine if all those includes for > later versions are removed from the base .defs and .overrides files. > > ----- Original Message ----- From: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> > To: "Andrei Zmievski" <andrei@gravitonic.com>; "Anant Narayanan" > <anant@kix.in> > Cc: "Elizabeth M Smith" <auroraeosrose@gmail.com>; "PHP-GTK dev" > <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> > Sent: Monday, January 21, 2008 2:58 AM > Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release? > > >> Findings: >> >> 1. Versioning's 99% of the way there but doesn't work with older >> versions. I.e. my 2.6 build, although correctly identified as such, >> tries to include 2.10 features for some still-unknown reason and so >> fails. We should probably simply have later versions include older >> overrides from the start, rather than do fancy footwork to make the >> older version skip over them, no? Does anyone know a good reason not >> to do it that way? >> 2. We need to get Edin to kill the GTK+ 1.3 headers in his zip.zip >> (win32 build environment). That had me going for a bit :\ >> 3. Little bits and pieces need tidying up, e.g. if I configure --all >> and a header for a lowly extension happens to be missing the entire >> build aborts. This was less of a problem when we only had one >> extension than it is now. --all should probably force the build and >> give just a warning at that point, so long as php-gtk itself is built. >> There are also a lot of compiler warnings here... I know the ZVAL_ZVAL >> definition in the Zend Engine throws some we can't get around, but >> it'd be nice to get this a bit cleaner. That's, erm, when it will >> build here :) >> >> Will spend some time on it tomorrow. >> >> - Steph >> >> ----- Original Message ----- From: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> >> To: "Andrei Zmievski" <andrei@gravitonic.com>; "Anant Narayanan" >> <anant@kix.in> >> Cc: "Elizabeth M Smith" <auroraeosrose@gmail.com>; "PHP-GTK dev" >> <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> >> Sent: Sunday, January 20, 2008 6:59 PM >> Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release? >> >> >>> Sorry, I'll be with you in a couple of hours. >>> >>> ----- Original Message ----- From: "Andrei Zmievski" >>> <andrei@gravitonic.com> >>> To: "Anant Narayanan" <anant@kix.in> >>> Cc: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com>; "Elizabeth M Smith" >>> <auroraeosrose@gmail.com>; "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> >>> Sent: Sunday, January 20, 2008 6:50 PM >>> Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release? >>> >>> >>>> I'm just waiting on the 'dows folks. As soon as they confirm all is >>>> well, I'll tag and release. >>>> >>>> -Andrei >>>> >>>> On Jan 20, 2008, at 6:42 AM, Anant Narayanan wrote: >>>> >>>>> Hi, >>>>> >>>>>> I wouldn't be too specific about how long it was in development.. >>>>>> makes us look slow. :) Could just say "after a long development >>>>>> and QA cycle". >>>>> >>>>> Revised announcement: >>>>> >>>>> -- >>>>> After a long development and QA cycle, we are proud to release >>>>> version 2.0 of PHP-GTK. Although >>>>> support for more recent versions than 2.8 is not 100% complete, we >>>>> hope to cover as much of the API as possible in upcoming releases. >>>>> >>>>> This release comes with support for custom GTypes and Signals, more >>>>> API coverage, and the usual slew of bug fixes. email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release?
email.body:
> This might be a silly question... but if I recall right the last > build Elizabeth did was Unzip and go all self contained on Windows, > did not interact with the system GTK... so... why not just /give/ > them Gtk 2.12. Then everyone will be using a PHP-GTK2 with max > features for max lawlz without borking the system.
Giving them GTK 2.12 would be a bad move as not even 10% of the new classes have been implemented. We shouldn't go beyond 2.8.
Cheers, Anant
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release?
email.body:
I think you mean beyond 2.10. We've already given out 2.10 for previous versions. Backtracking now would be *bad*.
If it was my choice I would give them 2.12 and a list of what works. It is not like giving them 2.12 disables a bunch of 2.8 functions. It just adds to what they might want to use. More is always better.
Yeah that makes the project look incomplete but that is because /it is/ incomplete. I probably would have called the alpha 2.0.0, beta 2.0.1, and this 2.0.2.
At this rate it will never be 100% as GTK grows at a rate faster than PHP-GTK does, and calling a 2.0.0 with 2 year old GTK version makes you feel like that day you were chatting with a beautiful woman online just to find out she was a balding 45 year old man (...).
My third suggestion would be to call this PHP-GTK2-2.0.0(delta|gamma|whatever) instead. The 'alpha' was never a 'real' 'alpha' and the 'beta' was never really a 'real' 'beta' anyway. And then just continue on with that trend still PHP6 *i make giggle*
Also in the Unix world, all new systems worth their effort come with the latest software (even Solaris with Blastwave :o !), so we'll just be causing a divide in operating systems. I took the 2.6 precompiled Unix versions down off my site, and 2.8 is coming down soon too.
-- Bob Majdak Jr KateOS Rofflecopter Pilot http://www.kateos.org
Anant Narayanan wrote: >> This might be a silly question... but if I recall right the last build >> Elizabeth did was Unzip and go all self contained on Windows, did not >> interact with the system GTK... so... why not just /give/ them Gtk >> 2.12. Then everyone will be using a PHP-GTK2 with max features for max >> lawlz without borking the system. > > Giving them GTK 2.12 would be a bad move as not even 10% of the new > classes have been implemented. We shouldn't go beyond 2.8. > > Cheers, > Anant >
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release?
email.body:
It's not just that - it's more that if we're saying it works with GTK 2.6 up it should work for _everybody_ with GTK 2.6. up. There's a free compiler available for Windows now, so we're seeing more and more doze users picking up the cudgels these days.
Does anybody know where all that generator code for Drawable_Arg is used? I'm having trouble tracking it down, but it could be 'cos I'm still mucking about with 2.6 here. Do later GTKs use it? (NB - I can't see where it's called from elsewhere in the generator either - and it makes no difference to the gen files, which is a bit of a clue.) It's mostly that that's breaking E_STRICT compatibility.
- Steph

>> This might be a silly question... but if I recall right the last build >> Elizabeth did was Unzip and go all self contained on Windows, did not >> interact with the system GTK... so... why not just /give/ them Gtk 2.12. >> Then everyone will be using a PHP-GTK2 with max features for max lawlz >> without borking the system. > > Giving them GTK 2.12 would be a bad move as not even 10% of the new > classes have been implemented. We shouldn't go beyond 2.8. > > Cheers, > Anant
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release?
email.body:
>I think you mean beyond 2.10. We've already given out 2.10 for previous >versions. Backtracking now would be *bad*.
Wow, really? I thought I'd only missed a beta...
> If it was my choice I would give them 2.12 and a list of what works. It is > not like giving them 2.12 disables a bunch of 2.8 functions. It just adds > to what they might want to use. More is always better.
So you're using PHP 6.0? ;)
> Yeah that makes the project look incomplete but that is because /it is/ > incomplete. I probably would have called the alpha 2.0.0, beta 2.0.1, and > this 2.0.2. > > At this rate it will never be 100% as GTK grows at a rate faster than > PHP-GTK does, and calling a 2.0.0 with 2 year old GTK version makes you > feel like that day you were chatting with a beautiful woman online just to > find out she was a balding 45 year old man (...). > > My third suggestion would be to call this > PHP-GTK2-2.0.0(delta|gamma|whatever) instead. The 'alpha' was never a > 'real' 'alpha' and the 'beta' was never really a 'real' 'beta' anyway. And > then just continue on with that trend still PHP6 *i make giggle*
It doesn't work. We tried that with zeta, but version_compare() never heard of zeta so we had to backtrack.
> Also in the Unix world, all new systems worth their effort come with the > latest software (even Solaris with Blastwave :o !), so we'll just be > causing a divide in operating systems. I took the 2.6 precompiled Unix > versions down off my site, and 2.8 is coming down soon too.
Don't confuse 'supports' with 'the supplied binary is rolled with'. We'll probably roll with 2.10 or 2.12, certainly not with anything earlier, but we _support_ from 2.6 up, which is why I'm testing it in the first place. Or are you suggesting we deliberately switch off GTK 2.6, thereby taking a completely different approach to GTK itself?
- Steph
> > -- > Bob Majdak Jr > KateOS Rofflecopter Pilot > http://www.kateos.org > > Anant Narayanan wrote: >>> This might be a silly question... but if I recall right the last build >>> Elizabeth did was Unzip and go all self contained on Windows, did not >>> interact with the system GTK... so... why not just /give/ them Gtk 2.12. >>> Then everyone will be using a PHP-GTK2 with max features for max lawlz >>> without borking the system. >> >> Giving them GTK 2.12 would be a bad move as not even 10% of the new >> classes have been implemented. We shouldn't go beyond 2.8. >> >> Cheers, >> Anant >> > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >

email.body:
>> I think you mean beyond 2.10. We've already given out 2.10 for previous >> versions. Backtracking now would be *bad*. > > Sure we can still give out versions 2.10 and 2.12 but the primary focus > should still be on something we can reasonably support. We did give out a > 2.8 tarball last time, in *addition* to the 2.10 one.
Hm, I think Bob's focusing on Windows here, which _was_ purely 2.10.
What's with the differently-labelled src tarballs? Or was that prior to versioning?
- Steph

email.body:
> So you're using PHP 6.0? ;)
>_> show of hands who is sad to see magic quotes go? lol.
> Don't confuse 'supports' with 'the supplied binary is rolled with'. > We'll probably roll with 2.10 or 2.12
Yeah I been ranting about what it is 'rolled' with this entire time... Sort of. If it is packed with 2.12 but you /do not build/ with the 2.12 def/overrides then everything I said is mostly valid since none of the 2.12 features we have done will be available.
Though Microsoft quit supporting W95 not sure why anyone else should bother.
-- Bob Majdak Jr KateOS Rofflecopter Pilot http://www.kateos.org

email.body:
> I think you mean beyond 2.10. We've already given out 2.10 for > previous versions. Backtracking now would be *bad*.
Sure we can still give out versions 2.10 and 2.12 but the primary focus should still be on something we can reasonably support. We did give out a 2.8 tarball last time, in *addition* to the 2.10 one.
Cheers, Anant

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release?
email.body:
>>> I think you mean beyond 2.10. We've already given out 2.10 for >>> previous versions. Backtracking now would be *bad*. >> >> Sure we can still give out versions 2.10 and 2.12 but the primary >> focus should still be on something we can reasonably support. We >> did give out a 2.8 tarball last time, in *addition* to the 2.10 one. > > Hm, I think Bob's focusing on Windows here, which _was_ purely 2.10.
Oh, indeed - My mistake. I thought we had a 2.8 tarball for Windows too. I guess that means we can't go below 2.10 then.
> What's with the differently-labelled src tarballs? Or was that prior > to versioning?
That was to hide a bug from the users - the 2.10 includes would not allow the 2.8 version to compile. The 2.8 source tarball had the 2.10 includes manually commented out before release. The bug has been fixed now, though.
Cheers, Anant
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release?
email.body:
>> So you're using PHP 6.0? ;) > > >_> show of hands who is sad to see magic quotes go? lol.
:)
>> Don't confuse 'supports' with 'the supplied binary is rolled with'. We'll >> probably roll with 2.10 or 2.12 > > Yeah I been ranting about what it is 'rolled' with this entire time... > Sort of. If it is packed with 2.12 but you /do not build/ with the 2.12 > def/overrides
The idea is that if it's rolled with 2.12 it will automatically build with 2.12 defs. If it's rolled with 2.6 it will automatically build with 2.6 defs.
> then everything I said is mostly valid since none of the 2.12 features we > have done will be available.
I think I just killed your argument...
> Though Microsoft quit supporting W95 not sure why anyone else should > bother.
I'm not even going to join in on that one. I spent time last month struggling with ICU, which doesn't support MSVC 6 'because it's old'. We have to use MSVC 6 for PHP because Apache uses MSVC 6, you'd have a choice of CLI or CGI otherwise. They do so because it still is the only runtime that works everywhere... changes upcoming in the next years tho'.
- Steph

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release?
email.body:
Hi Andrei,
I'm just waiting for people to test the stuff I put in, which should've theoretically made shared extensions possible on *nix. So far we've had two *nix responses, one saying ay and one saying nay. Could do with a few more 'ay's in there and an investigation into the 'nay', since all I really did was make it like it used to be.
I'd rather Elizabeth did the actual rolling thing for doze, I screwed up last time because I've so many copies of various non-MS elements floating around on my system. Assuming you have time, Elizabeth?
- Steph

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release?
email.body:
> -o ext/sourceview/.libs/gen_sourceview.o > In file included from ext/sourceview/gen_sourceview.c:16: > /home/leon/Build/php-gtk/main/php_gtk_api.h:1:30: error: > ext/gtk+/gen_gtk.h: > No such file or directory > /home/leon/Build/php-gtk/main/php_gtk_api.h:2:30: error: > ext/gtk+/gen_gdk.h: > No such file or directory > /home/leon/Build/php-gtk/main/php_gtk_api.h:3:30: error: > ext/gtk+/gen_atk.h: > No such file or directory
Well there's the problem - but it'll take a *nix person to figure that one out because it's a completely different build system. For example, are those generated files deleted automatically under the *nix build system when a PHP-GTK build is complete?
- Steph
ps Thanks for testing!

Andrei? Bob?

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release?
email.body:
I didn't write sourceview. :)
-Andrei
Steph Fox wrote: > .. or is it just a path issue? > > (Sorry, didn't spot that possibility earlier.) > > Andrei? Bob? > > ----- Original Message ----- From: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> > To: "Mr L. Pegg" <leon.pegg@gmail.com>; <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> > Sent: Friday, January 25, 2008 11:57 PM > Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release? > > >>> -o ext/sourceview/.libs/gen_sourceview.o >>> In file included from ext/sourceview/gen_sourceview.c:16: >>> /home/leon/Build/php-gtk/main/php_gtk_api.h:1:30: error: >>> ext/gtk+/gen_gtk.h: >>> No such file or directory >>> /home/leon/Build/php-gtk/main/php_gtk_api.h:2:30: error: >>> ext/gtk+/gen_gdk.h: >>> No such file or directory >>> /home/leon/Build/php-gtk/main/php_gtk_api.h:3:30: error: >>> ext/gtk+/gen_atk.h: >>> No such file or directory >> >> Well there's the problem - but it'll take a *nix person to figure that >> one out because it's a completely different build system. email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release?
email.body:
No, but you did a lot of work on libglade. Is that building as shared for you?
----- Original Message ----- From: "Andrei Zmievski" <andrei@gravitonic.com> To: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> Cc: "Mr L. Pegg" <leon.pegg@gmail.com>; <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net>; "Bob Majdak Jr" <bmajdak@php.net> Sent: Saturday, January 26, 2008 1:46 AM Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release?
>I didn't write sourceview. :) > > -Andrei > > Steph Fox wrote: >> .. or is it just a path issue? >> >> (Sorry, didn't spot that possibility earlier.) >> >> Andrei? Bob? >> >> ----- Original Message ----- From: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> >> To: "Mr L. email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release?
email.body:
>> -o ext/sourceview/.libs/gen_sourceview.o >> In file included from ext/sourceview/gen_sourceview.c:16: >> /home/leon/Build/php-gtk/main/php_gtk_api.h:1:30: error: ext/gtk+/ >> gen_gtk.h: >> No such file or directory >> /home/leon/Build/php-gtk/main/php_gtk_api.h:2:30: error: ext/gtk+/ >> gen_gdk.h: >> No such file or directory >> /home/leon/Build/php-gtk/main/php_gtk_api.h:3:30: error: ext/gtk+/ >> gen_atk.h: >> No such file or directory > > Well there's the problem - but it'll take a *nix person to figure > that one out because it's a completely different build system. For > example, are those generated files deleted automatically under the > *nix build system when a PHP-GTK build is complete?
Ok, looks like I get the same error on a fresh checkout. It's trying to build sourceview *before* gtk+, which is why the gen_* files aren't there yet.
I thought we fixed the ordering issue sometime back - oddly this crops up only when we use the =shared option.
As for libglade, it builds, but no .so is generated anywhere (still static) :-)
-- Anant
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

Tag it so I can get the same source for the windows build and I'll do one with the 2.12 libs.
Thanks, Elizabeth

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release?
email.body:
Hi Andrei,
As far as I'm aware, Elizabeth currently is the only person equipped to roll the official doze stuff for PHP-GTK. I can manage most things, but PHP-GTK has so many dependencies and I have so much 'stuff' floating around on my creaking system I'm bound to end up missing half the package out. That's what happened last time, and that's why I don't want to repeat the experience :) maybe when I get my next laptop I'll think about this before installing every *nix/win32 port known to man in root.
Bob and Anant were talking at some point about renaming PHP-GTK extension .so files to have a 2 on the end. I can't recall if anyone got around to actually doing this. If it requires changes to PHP-GTK sources I'll need to adapt win32 build system to deal with it prior to beta-tagging.
I also would like to know if anyone tested the changes I made to Elizabeth's GD 'hack' for Windows, since I actually don't know how to test it...
- Steph

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release?
email.body:
http://marc.info/?t=120112559300004&r=1&w=2
My bad - the idea wasn't to suffix names with 2, but to prefix them with php_gtk_ (in line with our .dll naming conventions). The idea being to prevent third-party library collisions.
- Steph
>I can change PHP-GTK to output php-gtk2.so if we so desire (but the >extension .so's will not be versioned this way). > > -Andrei > > On Feb 22, 2008, at 5:42 PM, Steph Fox wrote: > >> Hi Andrei, >> >> As far as I'm aware, Elizabeth currently is the only person equipped to >> roll the official doze stuff for PHP-GTK. email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] experimenting
email.body:
I found you can get around the hyphen issue if you don't mind abandoning 'php-gtk' as the prefix. 'gtk' or 'phpgtk' will work just as well.
You just need to rename the INI declarations (and any reference to them) in php_gtk.c. I thought these were tied up with the module declaration in Zend/TSRM, but apparently not so:
//php.ini error_reporting=E_ALL|E_STRICT extension_dir=./ date.timezone=Europe/London extension=php_gtk2.dll phpgtk.codepage=CP1250 phpgtk.extensions=php_gtk_libglade2.dll
C:\sandbox\1053testarea>php -r "print_r(get_declared_classes());" // lots of stuff.. [339] => Glade [340] => GladeXML )
php -r "phpinfo(INFO_MODULES);" ... ... php-gtk
GTK+ support => enabled GTK+ v => 2.10.7
Directive => Local Value => Master Value phpgtk.codepage => CP1250 => CP1250 phpgtk.extensions => php_gtk_libglade2.dll => php_gtk_libglade2.dll ... ...
C:\sandbox\1053testarea>php -r "print_r(ini_get_all('php-gtk'));" Array ( [phpgtk.codepage] => Array ( [global_value] => CP1250 [local_value] => CP1250 [access] => 7 )
[phpgtk.extensions] => Array ( [global_value] => php_gtk_libglade2.dll [local_value] => php_gtk_libglade2.dll [access] => 4 )
)
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] [patch] GtkScaleButton Methods
email.body:
Should be fine.
Bob Majdak Jr wrote: > Using only GCC I would never notice (or care really :z). How do these > other compilers feel about basic pointer arithmetic? > > list = g_malloc0(sizeof(gchar *) * (listlen + 2)); > //. space for not overwriting the head pointer and leaving a null on > //. the tail end. > > --- > > gtk_scale_button_set_icons( > GTK_SCALE_BUTTON(button), > (const gchar **)(list+1) > ); > > --- > > if(list) { > g_strfreev(list); > } > > > > Andrei Zmievski wrote: >> We shouldn't use C99's syntax, since not all compilers support it. I'm >> talking about initializing an array from a non-const value. >> >> -Andrei >> >> + if(iconlist) >> + listlen = zend_hash_num_elements(Z_ARRVAL_P(iconlist)); >> + else >> + listlen = 0; >> + >> + gchar *list[listlen+1]; >> + iter = 0; >> >

email.body:
Did you try a fresh checkout? This should be fixed now.

>I can't seem to build a shared extension at all. I could look at the >renaming issue once I've figured that out. > > - Anant > > On 24-Jan-08, at 6:04 AM, Steph Fox wrote: >> OK, that needs a *nix build merchant - if you agree that it's a bug. >> >> I would've expected it to be sourceview.so from the code, but I don't >> know if that's wrong or not. And I don't have any way to check it out >> anyways. >> >> Thanks for testing Bob, thousands don't. >> >> - Steph >> >> ----- Original Message ----- From: "Bob Majdak Jr" <bob@kateos.org> >> To: "PHP-GTK Developers" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> >> Sent: Wednesday, January 23, 2008 9:54 PM >> Subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: nix shared ext >> >> >>> Steph Fox Wrote: >>> > Theoretically, *nix shared extension builds should work now. >>> > Please let me know if they needed a '2' on the end... >>> >>> I tested it with GtkSourceView only and it worked. Built, installed, >>> and ran it fine. However it still has the "wrong" filename, it ends up >>> as sourceview.so instead of php_gtk2_sourceview.so. >>> >>> changelog wrote: >>>> changelog Wed Jan 23 01:31:44 2008 UTC >>>> >>>> Modified files: /php-gtk ChangeLog Log: >>>> ChangeLog update >>>> http://cvs.php.net/viewvc.cgi/php-gtk/ChangeLog?r1=1.568&r2=1.569&diff_format=u >>>> Index: php-gtk/ChangeLog >>>> diff -u php-gtk/ChangeLog:1.568 php-gtk/ChangeLog:1.569 >>>> --- php-gtk/ChangeLog:1.568 Tue Jan 22 01:31:40 2008 >>>> +++ php-gtk/ChangeLog Wed Jan 23 01:31:44 2008 >>>> @@ -1,3 +1,40 @@ >>>> +2008-01-22 Steph Fox <steph.fox@virgin.net> >>>> + >>>> + * ext/extra/php_gtkextra.c >>>> + ext/html/php_html.c >>>> + ext/libglade/php_libglade.c >>>> + ext/libsexy/php_libsexy.c >>>> + ext/mozembed/php_mozembed.c >>>> + ext/scintilla/php_scintilla.c >>>> + ext/sourceview/php_sourceview.c >>>> + ext/spell/php_spell.c >>>> + win32/confutils.js: >>>> + Theoretically, *nix shared extension builds should work now. >>>> Please let me >>>> + know if they needed a '2' on the end... >>>> + >>>> + * ext/gtk+/gdk-2.10.defs >>>> + ext/gtk+/gdk-2.12.defs >>>> + ext/gtk+/gdk.defs >>>> + ext/gtk+/gtk-2.10.defs >>>> + ext/gtk+/gtk-2.12.defs >>>> + ext/gtk+/gtk-2.8.defs >>>> + ext/gtk+/gtk.defs >>>> + generator/override.php >>>> + generator/scheme.php: >>>> + Defs should only include the previous version .defs file and >>>> the current >>>> + types.defs file, if one exists. Note that def caches are now >>>> versioned. >>>> + >>>> + * ext/gtk+/gdk-2.12.overrides >>>> + ext/gtk+/gdk.overrides >>>> + ext/gtk+/gtk-2.10.overrides >>>> + ext/gtk+/gtk-2.12.overrides >>>> + ext/gtk+/gtk-2.8.overrides >>>> + ext/gtk+/gtk.overrides >>>> + generator/override.php >>>> + generator/scheme.php: >>>> + This works fine, but I forgot to move the defs to the new >>>> scheme. (Cue >>>> + much confusion here - until now.) >>>> + >>>> 2008-01-21 Bob Majdak Jr <bob@kateos.org> >>>> * ext/sourceview/sourceview.defs >>>> >>> >>> -- >>> Bob Majdak Jr >>> KateOS Rofflecopter Pilot >>> http://www.kateos.org >>> >>> -- >>> PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) >>> To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >> >> -- >> PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) >> To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php > > -- > PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) > To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >

----- Original Message ----- From: "Jani Taskinen" <jani.taskinen@sci.fi> To: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> Cc: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> Sent: Thursday, January 24, 2008 12:10 PM Subject: Re: Fw: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: INI problem
> Why do you change those ext/date/ directives??? > > And it doesn't matter if a directive is registered or not. It's > perfectly valid to set any own values in php.ini. If you look at the > existing tests, you'll see what I mean. :D > For example: > > ext/standard/tests/general_functions/parse_ini_basic.data > > --Jani > > > > On Thu, 2008-01-24 at 12:04 +0000, Steph Fox wrote: >> Hi Jani, >> >> OK, those GC/build fixes are in CVS now (Dmitry/Stas awake). >> >> Your fix + test with ext/date attached, should apply to 5_3 locally >> without >> pain. I don't think there's any way to write a phpt test for this one >> though, since there are no hyphens in the core INI directives. >> >> - Steph >> >> ----- Original Message ----- >> From: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> >> To: <jani.taskinen@iki.fi> >> Cc: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> >> Sent: Wednesday, January 23, 2008 7:21 PM >> Subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: INI problem >> >> >> > Yep, that works. Attached is a patch containing your fix + a test with >> > ext/date INI directives, please don't go committing that wholesale ;) I >> > just >> > built it and ran ini_get_all('date'); >> > >> > There are also a couple of trivial ZE fixes in the patch that may or >> > may >> > not >> > have been sorted by the time you get a chance to look at this. Dmitry >> > aware. >> > >> > - Steph >> > >> > ----- Original Message ----- >> > From: "Jani Taskinen" <jani.taskinen@sci.fi> >> > To: "Steph Fox" <steph@zend.com> >> > Cc: "PHP-GTK dev" <php-gtk-dev@lists.php.net> >> > Sent: Wednesday, January 23, 2008 11:17 AM >> > Subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: INI problem >> > >> > >> >>I look into this once I get some free time. I'm quite busy at work >> >>right >> >> now. It's simple though, you just need to allow the name have hyphen >> >> in >> >> it. Propably just changing this line in zend_ini_scanner.l: >> >> >> >> LABEL [a-zA-Z0-9][a-zA-Z0-9._]* >> >> >> >> to >> >> >> >> LABEL [a-zA-Z0-9][a-zA-Z0-9._-]* >> >> >> >> No time to test right now. :) >> >> >> >> --Jani >> >> >> >> >> >> On Tue, 2008-01-22 at 22:44 +0000, Steph Fox wrote: >> >>> Hi all, >> >>> >> >>> I went to fix the shared build issue on *nix and discovered we can't >> >>> load >> >>> PHP-GTK extensions in 5.3.0 even under Windows. Hyphens are illegal >> >>> syntax >> >>> in INI directives now. (I know this because an old 5.3-dev told me >> >>> so - >> >>> the >> >>> current message is rather less helpful, it just says 'parse error'.) >> >>> >> >>> Renaming our INI directives to use underscores doesn't work because >> >>> the >> >>> prefix needs to match the extension name... >> >>> >> >>> Jani, can you assist? >> >>> >> >>> Thanks, >> >>> >> >>> - Steph >> >>> >> >> -- >> >> Patches/Donations: http://pecl.php.net/~jani/ >> >> >> >> -- >> >> PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) >> >> To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php >> >> >> > > -- > Patches/Donations: http://pecl.php.net/~jani/ > >
["hyphen_reinstated3.txt" (text/plain)]

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Release?
email.body:
Hi Anant,
> Ok, looks like I get the same error on a fresh checkout. It's trying to > build sourceview *before* gtk+, which is why the gen_* files aren't there > yet. > > I thought we fixed the ordering issue sometime back - oddly this crops up > only when we use the =shared option.
Ah right, on doze we use the build script to make sure that our php_gtk.lib is built before we try building anything against it. It's not odd at all that static libs build anyway, since they're built into that same binary and share the same symbols.
> As for libglade, it builds, but no .so is generated anywhere (still > static) :-)
That's got to be a glitch in the build script for the extension, unless Andrei forced it to build static? (I was thinking of doing the same under doze... not sure yet.)
- Steph
> -- > Anant
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Cairo Functionalities
email.body:
Hi,
Can we make cairo a hard dependency for php-gtk? There are several functions which require cairo support.
The famous ones include the gtk_print_context_* ones. More importantly, direct cairo drawing support can be added by returning a CairoContext object from gdkWindow - leading to the availability of custom widgets.
So, we plan to define an #ifdef if cairo is found, and if it is not, we simply don't build the corresponding methods (much like how the 2.8/2.10 overrides are handled currently). Is this approach OK?
Any comments or suggestions are greatly appreciated.
Regards, Akshat Gupta

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] #45938 [Com]: Ã± is not supported

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Linux and building PHP-GTK modules as shared
email.body:
Hello,
I had trouble compiling php-gtk extensions as shared; they weren't correctly linked with their respective libraries. The following patch addresses this issue and I thought I'd share it with you so it could be incorporated into future versions.
http://aur.archlinux.org/packages/php-gtk/php-gtk/shared-link.patch
Regards,
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

The following patch > addresses this issue and I thought I'd share it with you so it could be > incorporated into future versions. > > http://aur.archlinux.org/packages/php-gtk/php-gtk/shared-link.patch > > Regards, >

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] [Fwd: PHP-GTK 2.0.1 / Suggestion at configure script]
email.body:
["PHP-GTK 2.0.1 / Suggestion at configure script.eml" (message/rfc822)]
Delivered-To: andrei@gravitonic.com Received: by 10.180.252.15 with SMTP id z15cs46110bkh; Mon, 1 Sep 2008 11:36:15 -0700 (PDT) Received: by 10.140.133.10 with SMTP id g10mr3625575rvd.170.1220294172553; Mon, 01 Sep 2008 11:36:12 -0700 (PDT) Return-Path: <SRS0=wSTh=ZL=tecnolivre.ufla.br=rubens@php.net> Received: from osu1.php.net (osu1.php.net [140.211.166.39]) by mx.google.com with ESMTP id g31si11038962rvb.7.2008.09.01.11.36.11; Mon, 01 Sep 2008 11:36:12 -0700 (PDT) Received-SPF: pass (google.com: domain of \ SRS0=wSTh=ZL=tecnolivre.ufla.br=rubens@php.net designates 140.211.166.39 as permitted \ sender) client-ip=140.211.166.39; Authentication-Results: mx.google.com; spf=pass (google.com: domain of \ SRS0=wSTh=ZL=tecnolivre.ufla.br=rubens@php.net designates 140.211.166.39 as permitted \ sender) smtp.mail=SRS0=wSTh=ZL=tecnolivre.ufla.br=rubens@php.net Return-Path: <rubens@tecnolivre.ufla.br> Authentication-Results: osu1.php.net smtp.mail=rubens@tecnolivre.ufla.br; \ spf=neutral; sender-id=neutral Authentication-Results: osu1.php.net header.from=rubens@tecnolivre.ufla.br; \ sender-id=neutral Received: from [200.131.251.203] ([200.131.251.203:49351] \ helo=mail.tecnolivre.ufla.br) by osu1.php.net (envelope-from \ <rubens@tecnolivre.ufla.br>) (ecelerity 2.2.2.32 r(25190M)) with ESMTP id D5/7A-05202-4283CB84; Mon, 01 Sep 2008 11:45:01 -0700 Received: from mail.tecnolivre.ufla.br (localhost [127.0.0.1]) by mail.tecnolivre.ufla.br (Postfix) with ESMTP id A334E1E713C for <andrei@php.net>; Mon, 1 Sep 2008 15:39:14 -0300 (BRT) MIME-Version: 1.0 Date: Mon, 1 Sep 2008 15:39:14 -0300 From: Rubens Takiguti Ribeiro <rubens@tecnolivre.ufla.br> To: andrei@php.net Subject: PHP-GTK 2.0.1 / Suggestion at configure script Organization: TecnoLivre Message-ID: <394080cd8dc27dc2f83ddf3370afb0b6@localhost> X-Sender: rubens@tecnolivre.ufla.br User-Agent: TecnoLivre Webmail Content-Type: text/plain; charset="UTF-8" Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit
Hi,
I'm a programmer and I have a suggestion (or a question) about the configure script of PHP-GTK 2.0.1.
I receive the message "Could not locate PHP executable" after try to install PHP-GTK on Fedora Linux 7 / Apache 2.2.8 / PHP 5.2.6.
This message is in configure script, in my case, at line 3937. I saw that the line 3917 has this test:
"if test -x $PHP_PREFIX/bin/php; then ..."
In fact it was checking if my PHP executable is in default path, but, in my case, it is at "/usr/bin/php" (I've changed in PHP compilation). I don't understand why it could not use "php-config --php-binary" to determine the PHP executable location.
I could create a symbolic link in "$PHP_PREFIX/bin/php", but I change the configure script to do this test: " PHP=`$PHP_CONFIG --php-binary` if [ -x "$PHP" -o -x "$PHP_PREFIX/bin/php" ]; then ... if [ -x "$PHP_PREFIX/bin/php" ]; then PHP=$PHP_PREFIX/bin/php fi ... "
And it works. The code is not so good, but the suggestion is to use "php-config" not only to determine PHP_PREFIX, but the PHP executable too.
-- Rubens Takiguti Ribeiro TecnoLivre - Cooperativa de Tecnologia e Soluções Livres
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] win32
email.body:
Hello Harald,
> is there someone using win32 calls ? > > i looking for a was to use windows dll's for together with php-gtk. > some already used it ? > the proglem ist not php or gtk , its the machanism to call a dll
The following code uses win32 syscalls: http://cvs.php.net/viewvc.cgi/pear/System_WinDrives/WinDrives.php?view=markup
-- Regards/Mit freundlichen Grüßen Christian Weiske
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: win32
email.body:
Harald Thoeny wrote: > hi, > > is there someone using win32 calls ? > > i looking for a was to use windows dll's for together with php-gtk. > some already used it ? > the proglem ist not php or gtk , its the machanism to call a dll > > > thanks
To call windows dlls you need a PHP extension that can handle it - the code cweiske showed you uses ffi - available from pecl
You can also make some standard calls through the win32std extension - also from pecl
Or you can try to find com versions of what you need and use them from the com/.net extension which is standard with the windows version of PHP
Thanks, Elizabeth
-- PHP-GTK Development Mailing List (http://gtk.php.net/) To unsubscribe, visit: http://www.php.net/unsub.php

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] #45844 [Com]: gtkhtml doesn't provides gtk_html_request_paste
email.body:
Andrei Zmievski wrote: > Liz, do you think we should apply this? > > Keisial at gmail dot com wrote: >> ID: 45844 >> Comment by: Keisial at gmail dot com >> Reported By: Fedora at FamilleCollet dot com >> Status: Open >> Bug Type: PHP-GTK related >> Operating System: Linux (Fedora 9) >> PHP Version: 5.3.0alpha1 >> New Comment: >> >> This fixes the link issue i was habing with gtkhtml (link error to that >> funcion). >> However, i don't think the second part of the patch is needed. We are >> *removing* one function. Thus it should still work with older gtkhtml >> versions which have it. >> >> >> Previous Comments: >> ------------------------------------------------------------------------ >> >> [2008-08-17 15:00:01] Fedora at FamilleCollet dot com >> >> Description: >> ------------ >> gtk_html_request_paste has been removed from gtkhtml. >> >> See : http://svn.gnome.org/viewvc/gtkhtml?view=revision&revision=8594 >> >> But still present until 3.18.3 in header. >> This is now fixed : >> http://svn.gnome.org/viewvc/gtkhtml?view=revision&revision=8923 >> >> I think it should be removed from php-gtk. >> >> Simple patch : >> http://rpms.famillecollet.com/files/php-gtk-html318.patch >> >> Regards >> >> >> >> ------------------------------------------------------------------------ >> >> > Should be fine to commit

email.subject: Re: [PHP-GTK-DEV] Re: [Fwd: PHP-GTK 2.0.1 / Suggestion at configure
email.body:
Andrei Zmievski wrote: > Do we want to do this? When was --php-binary added to php-config? > > -Andrei /Mon Aug 8 16:06:49 2005 UTC/ (3 years, 1 month ago) by /sniper/ http://cvs.php.net/viewvc.cgi/php-src/scripts/php-config.in?r1=1.2&r2=1.3 Looks safe to use.
Although instead of PHP, better use as variable name PHP_EXECUTABLE which is the one used on phpize.m4 for `$PHP_CONFIG --php-binary 2>/dev/null`
